ygData.subject: Re: Slightly OT Spoiler request
ygData.msgSnippet: Spoiler The orb comes off the Scryer, which occasionally spawns where the Shin Shaman spawns.  That is the room with the two waterfalls coming out of the
ygData.messageBody:
Spoiler































The orb comes off the Scryer, which occasionally spawns where the Shin
Shaman spawns. That is the room with the two waterfalls coming out of the
ceiling in a circular shape. To the left is a passage the leads down a
ramp. The shamans spawn up on the platform - and the scryer will rarely
spawn in the same place.

> ----------
> From: Kimes, Dean W.[SMTP:Dean_Kimes@...]
> Reply To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Sent: Tuesday, July 06, 1999 12:29 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: [eqbards] Slightly OT Spoiler request
>
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Heyo fellow loremasters!
>
> I was looking for info on the Shimmering Orb. I heard it is found
> in Upper Guk, but have no idea where. That place is huge! Any info on
> this
> would be appreciated. Also, what am I supposed to do with this stupid
> Bloodforge Hammer? I swear, you help a dwarf out, get him his vengeance
> and
> the little twerp gives ya a really heavy cool magic weapon ya can't
> possibly
> use. What's up with that? Must be some kinda dwarf joke on us poor wood
> elves. So some info on the Orb would be great, surely someone must know
> more than I. And, if ya got a friend looking for a big hammer on E'ci,
> give
> me a tell.
>
> Kitasi of E'ci
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
> [mailto:Michael.Garramone@...]
> Sent: Sunday, July 04, 1999 9:07 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Lore stuff (OT)
>
>
> From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <Michael.Garramone@...>
>
> as far as casters you are fighting not getting interrupted much, they
> probably have a higher channeling skill than a player caster at the same
> level, just as they can punch or slash for so much more. channeling is
> what
> allows a caster to continue casting a spell even while getting hit. plus
> the other mobs you are fighting may have a bash or stun skill that is a
> lot
> higher than a player tank at the same level (not to sure how these melee
> skills work, i just started a paladin and have never played anything other
> than bard or wizard).
>
> i don't know why i answered i don't even know what i just said =P i'm
> still
> waking up and bored to death at work.
>
> Shada Silverleaf, Level 49 Bard, Mithaniel Marr
> Erisi, Level 6 Paladin, Mithaniel Marr
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Tim and Mary Steed [mailto:timandmary@...]
> > Sent: Sunday, July 04, 1999 3:00 AM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Lore stuff (OT)
> >
> >
> > From: "Tim and Mary Steed" <timandmary@...>
> >
> > While I too would love to be able to have 2 Demon Claws
> > because I think it
> > would look cool, I am becoming more and more convinced that weapons of
> > varrying speeds make little difference when combatting spellcasters.
> >
> > /RANT
> >
> > I've been hanging out in Cazic Thule for a few weeks, and we
> > get our fair
> > share of casters there. It amazes me, day after day, how a
> > low level mob (to
> > us) can sustain over 100 points of damage in a split second,
> > and STILL get
> > their spells off 90% of the time, while a bard is bashed for
> > a single point
> > of damage and their song ends, or a spellcaster is smacked
> > for as single
> > point of damage and their spell is interrupted. Is this
> > something Verant did
> > to "give the monsters a chance"? Kinda like how a low level
> > mob can smack
> > you for 55 points of damage with a single swing, while we
> > bards probably
> > will never be able to dish out that type of damage, even when
> > our levels
> > approach the 40's?
> >
> > And does anyone know how "stunning" works? It seems like
> > whenever I am hit,
> > I am auto-stunned half the time, whether it was for 50
> > points, or 1 point of
> > damage I receive. Does it have anything to do with my armor?
> > With my Stamina
> > or Strength scores? Any ideas?
> >
> > /RANT OFF
> >
> > Sorry for the rant, it's the only thing I can think of to
> > complain about!
> > (smile)
> >
> > Tim - Tallonn - Bertox
> >
